direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - DAY Sun spikes through the jostling leaves of a maple tree. A strong wind bends them back, showing their light green bellies. This is a modest house in a row of modest houses. Propane tanks and farmland at their backs show this neighborhood to be more rural than suburb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in his driveway. His eyes, locked on the sky, narrow as he stares at...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stretching out on the horizon in front of him. It's a bruised sky filled with a vicious mixture of black and gray clouds. They swirl in and out of one another sending wispy tentacles toward the ground. Curtis stands, awestruck. The clouds move fast overhead. He looks up as they overtake his position. A light rain begins. The rain pats the ground. It makes soft indentions on his cotton shirt. He watches it hit the concrete, falling harder now. He notices something strange. The rain makes dark spots on the sidewalk. He pulls his shirt out and sees dark spots forming there. He holds his palm out flat in front of him. The rain pools. He rubs the water through his thumb and fingers. It's an amber color, viscous, like fresh motor oil. Curtis looks to the sky, the rain pelting his face now. Jagged, angry clouds blanketing overhead. The wind bends back the trunk of the maple tree. Curtis stands alone at the base of the surging STORM CELL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : TAKE SHELTER INT. BATHROOM - DAY Curtis holds his head under the running shower nozzle. Cool, clean water rushes over his face.

In the same motion, he takes the piece of toast from her hand and sets it on her plate.

direction.raw_text: Curtis loads pieces from the trash pile into a wheelbarrow. He keeps an eye on Hannah as she jumps on a small, plastic playscape in the middle of the backyard. The dog, Red, paces by the back door. He's agitated, but his movement is limited by the length of rope tied from his collar to a nearby post. He barks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis flinches at the loud boom. He looks to the sky and sees dark clouds twisting overhead. Hannah plays, unaffected by the noise. To get a better view, Curtis moves from beneath a tree in the corner of the yard and surveys the large swath of farmland that runs up to his property. Chain-link fencing partitions the yard from a deep concrete culvert that leads out to the open field. A giant STORM CELL gathers force on the horizon there. Red barks incessantly. He winces and strains against the rope tied to his collar. Curtis flinches again as A BOLT OF LIGHTNING streaks to the ground in the distance. Sparks shoot into the air leaving a circle of scorched crops. Another CRACK of thunder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A light rain begins. Red snaps his head around and bucks into the air. He gnashes at the rope. Curtis collects Hannah off the playscape and turns back to the approaching STORM CELL. He holds up his hand and studies the falling rain. It's the thick, amber colored liquid. With Hannah in his arms, Curtis watches, awestruck, as wispy tentacles drip to the ground forming a collection of THREE TORNADOS out in the field. Behind them, Red's teeth fray the rope at his collar. He thrashes his head, the rope SNAPS, and the dog flies toward Curtis and Hannah. Curtis turns to see Red charging them. He barely has time to set Hannah down before Red catches him by the forearm. They crash to the ground, tangled together. Rain coming down hard now. Curtis yells and waves Hannah back. Red, snapping, buries his teeth into the muscles in Curtis' arm. Blood streams from the wound. Curtis screams in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis bolts up in bed grabbing his forearm. He grinds his teeth and doubles over in pain. It takes a moment for him to find his bearings. His breathing slows. He gently rubs his hand over the skin on his arm. Sweat has collected around his collar and temples. From the bed, sheets in a twisted mess, he looks around the room unsure of what just happened to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eggs cool on a plate. Curtis sits at the kitchen table dressed for work. He stares vacantly at his breakfast. He looks up at Hannah. She sits on the floor surrounded by toy building blocks and plays with the dog. She rubs under Red's chest and in turn he licks her face. She smiles and gently pushes him away. Samantha sits with her knees up drinking coffee.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (holds up the mug) Better already. Samantha walks to her purse on the counter and roots through to find a set of keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I got my phone if you need anything. Don't forget Sunday lunch is here tomorrow. This reminder makes Curtis rub his face with a grunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're sick, we should cancel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, we'll talk later. She heads for the door with Hannah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Let's go. (TO CURTIS) You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Samantha scoops up her bag and takes Hannah by the hand. They leave the room. Curtis notices the dog, Red, sitting on his haunches looking at him. Curtis stares back, sipping his coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reverse lights shine as Curtis' pick-up rumbles backward. Curtis eyes the side mirror as he maneuvers the truck into his backyard. In the mirror, the trash pile comes into view. Just behind it, the STORM SHELTER doors appear. The truck shutters to a stop. Curtis studies the Shelter in the side mirror for a moment. A grassy bulge with angled metal doors peeking over the trash heap. He climbs out. A blue tarp is pulled from the bed of the truck, floating down to the yard. Curtis slips on a pair of work gloves and continues to eye the Storm Shelter. He yanks a bale of chain-link from the bed of the truck and carries it to the back corner of the yard. He steals another glance back toward the Shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dropping the bale, he sizes up the space. He looks to the sky. It's a beautiful day. He begins counting off steps from the back fence line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: linen sheet floats down over a folding table. -The hanging bag is placed on a portable clothes rod. -Hands place an assortment of home sewn crafts like napkins and embroidered pillows out onto the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tackle box is opened revealing a tray of small bills and change. A calculator is removed. Hannah kneels in front of a folding chair behind their BOOTH at an open-air flea market. She uses the seat of the chair as a table for a tiny porcelain tea set. Samantha stands over her display table smiling and nodding at perusing CUSTOMERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: mallet drives tall metal stakes into the ground. -The cord holding together the bale of chain-link is snipped and a boot rolls the fencing out flat. -Chain-link is attached to the stakes with a number of metal braids. -The prefab DOGHOUSE is set down in the back corner. Curtis stands in front of his newly created dog pen. It's waist high and about 7' X 10', tucked in the back left corner of the yard so that half of the pen is made up by the existing fencing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha turns to see a large woman holding up an intricately embroidered pillow. You can tell by the look of her that she's a flea market pro, a BARGAIN HUNTER(54).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you asking for this pillow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This pillow's fifteen dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's more than I want to spend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is all hand stitched. It takes a really long time. That's why I charge that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you seven for it. Samantha looks at the woman, who is almost daring her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go that low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's my offer. The woman sets down the pillow and begins looking over other items on the table. Samantha bites the inside of her cheek. She doesn't like to haggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about 10? The woman doesn't look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you eight, but it's in change. Samantha forces a smile and motions to Hannah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine. The woman smiles and removes a Ziplock bag of assorted coins from her purse. Hannah takes the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky for you she likes to count change. Hannah opens the bag and begins to turn it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - LATER Curtis unlatches a piece of the braided wire holding a separated section of fencing that acts like a gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red! Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He opens it and looks down at Red, who sits at his feet. He speaks gently to the dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in. Red walks into the pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good boy. Curtis closes the gate, kneels and places his hands on the fence. Red approaches so that his nose is touching Curtis' fingers. Curtis scratches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about this buddy. We just gotta work it like this for awhile okay? Curtis stands, wiping his hands off on his jeans. He sees the Storm Shelter poking up from behind the trash pile. He looks down at Red. Curtis walks to the Shelter. Clearing past the trash pile, the shelter appears, the mound fully visible. Curtis stops at the angled doors. He studies them. A rusted padlock is snapped shut across the handles. He reaches out and lifts up the padlock. He yanks on it, then lets it fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coins splash across the kitchen counter. Curtis sets an empty coffee can back on the shelf in front of him and begins sifting through the change. Odd screws, buttons, then he gets to what he's looking for. A small set of brass keys on a matching ring. He grabs the keys from the pile and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis walks back out to the storm shelter, keys in hand, long flashlight in his back pocket. He pulls up the padlock that holds the two rusted doors together. Popping off the rubber cover, he tries a key. The lock pops up. He unhooks it from the doors and lets it fall to the ground. Curtis strains to pull the first door open. It's heavy and sticks from lack of use. Finally, with a creak, the door swings back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis holds his head to the side, a musty odor coming from inside. He forces the second door open. Curtis stands in front of the shelter, a gaping black hole angled up from the earth. He takes the flashlight from his pocket and turns it on. It illuminates concrete steps leading down. The dog, nose at the fence, watches from his pen on the other side of the yard. Curtis enters the shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pitch black inside. Curtis makes his way down the steps and holds out the flashlight. An assortment of trash on the ground, empty cans and water bottles, some candy wrappers. The whole shelter is only about 6' X 8'. His head fits fine, but he still ducks like he might bump it. He shines the light on the back wall. A rotted, wooden bench is bolted into the concrete there. Curtis walks to it and takes a seat. He's looking back toward the steps now. A shaft of light cuts a strict beam through the open doors, lighting only the concrete entry. Curtis takes in the quiet of the concrete box. He leans his head back on the wall and closes his eyes. He shuts off his flashlight. Left in the dark, he takes a deep breath. Exhales slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While rescue workers made several attempts to reach the family, Walter Jacobs wife... Curtis sits in his Lazyboy bent over a frozen dinner. He watches the local news on TV. Samantha walks in with a glass of milk and some Oreos, a magazine tucked under her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha takes a TIN down from the top of the fridge. It has designs of starfish and other ocean creatures on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She sets the tin on the counter next to the tackle box she uses as a cash register and yells to Curtis in the den.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's what I don't understand. If he didn't do anything why did you put him out back? Samantha counts out the money earned at the flea market. She sets a portion aside and closes the tackle box. Curtis says something, but it's inaudible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? She opens the tin and removes an envelope with the word
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: written on it in black sharpie. Samantha adds the money to the envelope and puts up the jar. She opens the fridge and takes out the milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear me? I said if he didn't do anything why did you have to put him outside? Curtis' attention is on the TV. Samantha sits on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted him to be outside for awhile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's your dog. He's always been an inside dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my dog, and that's why he's outside. Right now with Hannah and everything I just think it'd be better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah loves Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on. Curtis stares at the television program. Samantha's eyes narrow. Frustrated, she flips open her magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the gas cloud spread across their six acre property. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only way off their land was across the train tracks which were blocked by wreckage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from a hospital bed) I tried using some wet rags and towels to breathe through but that just seemed to make it worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While rescue workers made several attempts to reach the family, Walter Jacobs' wife and brother-in- law died in the home. Jacobs survived despite enduring eleven hours of exposure to the gas cloud before finally being flown out by helicopter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hearin' this? Her nose still in the magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven hours. No way out. Samantha shakes her head. Curtis watches the footage of Walter Jacobs. He watches his red rimmed eyes. The deep lines in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - DAY It's daytime, but the house feels dark from the storm blowing outside. The SOUND of rain pelts the windows and roof. Curtis, dressed for work, walks from his bedroom down the hallway. He passes the den and stops at its entryway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah sits on the couch with her back to him. She's on her knees looking out one of the front windows. A dull orange glow halos from the bank of windows. What sunlight there is appears diffused by the dark, thick rain smearing down the outside of the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis flinches. He shows concern as heavier rain begins battering the house. The wind picks up making wood beams creak on their foundation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah. Hannah doesn't move. She continues staring out the window. The SOUND of the storm outside intensifies. Windows begin to rattle in their frames. Curtis walks over and reaches for Hannah but is startled by the sight of a MAN'S FACE just outside the window. Hannah and the Man have been staring at one another. The Man, hollow eyed and pale, moves out of the window and out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Thunder CRACKS overhead. Curtis scoops Hannah into his arms and heads out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The front door rattles. Curtis stops and turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BANG. The SOUND of someone kicking at the front door. The storm outside has grown to a deafening pitch. The power goes out. The entire house vibrates, like a freight train running across the roof. The BANGING at the front door continues, frame giving way, as the STORM reaches its apex. Curtis, holding Hannah, kneels and braces himself in the entryway to the den. He covers the back of Hannah's head with his hands and squeezes her tight into his shoulder. Then Silence. A stillness. The rain stops. No more banging at the front door. The SUN moves brightly though the front windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The furniture in the den lifts off the ground. A couch, Lazyboy, coffee table and lamp. It all hangs in the air, floating for a moment. Quietly. Curtis watches, eyes wide. A rumbling. Grows. The SUNLIGHT vanishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The sound of the storm is sucked back into the room as the furniture crashes to the floor, breaking apart on impact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The windows BLOW OUT. Curtis squeezes his eyes shut and pivots his body, trying to protect Hannah. Shards of glass splinter across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis gasps for air. It doesn't come. Gasp. He's sucking for a breath. Hyperventilating. He rises up in bed, gasping. His face flushed and head soaked in sweat. His eyes dart around the room, frantically searching his surroundings. One more gasp, and air enters his lungs. He coughs. More air. Long, deep breaths. He's calming down. His breathing comes under control. His attention turns to something else. Something under the sheets. Curtis pulls back the bed sheets. The mattress is soaked in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: urine. This scares him. His hand trembles as he reaches out to touch his wet boxers. The toilet FLUSHES. Footsteps in heels. Curtis quickly pulls the covers back up. Samantha enters the bedroom. She pulls her hair into a tight ponytail and picks earrings off a nearby dresser, her back to Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Babe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the number for Dr. Shannan? She turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're still not feeling good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but you got the number?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah baby but he'll be closed today. She approaches the bed and he holds his hand out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Yeah. I'll call tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey if you're not feeling good we take you in somewhere. She walks closer to the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Stop! She's taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Do you want me to cancel lunch today...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. It's just I got a sore throat. I'm sorry I'm taking it out on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was gonna leave Hannah with you so I could go to church, but I'm not going to with you like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine. I'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She needs breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry that you feel bad but you need to drop the attitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Just go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Just go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah's in the den. We have cereal for her. Samantha stomps out of the room. Curtis sighs. He halfway lifts the sheet then lets it fall again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis strips the sheets off the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The laundry room is a stackable set squeezed into a closet off the hallway. Curtis loads the sheets into the washer and presses start. Watching the clothes spin, a thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis pushes Hannah's shoe onto her foot. He stops with the shoes to concentrate. He moves his index finger from one shoulder to the other and speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going out. Confused, she slices her finger down an open palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with open palms) We're going out. Okay? It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis leads Hannah up the front walk of the Grafton Public Library. It's a one-story brick building with 1960's architecture. The parking lot is nearly empty behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis holds the glass front door open for Hannah. They stop in the entryway and survey the LIBRARY. There are only a few people, one of which is the LIBRARIAN sitting behind a central desk. It is an open room with cinder block walls painted in brightly colored shapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis finds the children's section to the left and leads Hannah over. She takes a seat at a kid's size table as Curtis grabs a Dinosaur book from a nearby display. Kneeling in front of her, Curtis shows her the book and motions with open hands to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stay put okay? Hannah begins looking through the book. Curtis stands, he sees a set of computers under a sign reading, "CATALOGUE".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis takes a seat in front of one of the two computers set up on a folding table. He eyes the search screen. Title, Author, Subject. He clicks on "Subject" and types the word "DREAMS". He scrolls through a list of titles and writes down a number. He looks back for Hannah. She's still flipping through her book. No one else is around. He begins another search. He types "MENTAL ILLNESS".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis scans the spines looking for his title. He already holds two books against his chest. He pulls out a thick hard cover book. The title reads, "Understanding Mental Illness."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CURTIS' TRUCK/GRAFTON STREETS - MOVING - DAY Hannah is once again strapped into her car seat. She holds a big children's book in her hands. They pass a Grocery Store. Curtis turns as it goes by. The truck pulls a U-turn in the street and heads for the store parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis pushes a cart down the aisle. Hannah rides in the fold down metal seat. They stop at the bottled water section. Curtis loads several plastic, gallon jugs of water into his cart. The cart is filled with an assortment of supplies: Batteries, canned food, first aid supplies, matches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha sits in the dining room at a fully dressed table. Steam rises off bowls of mashed potatoes and green beans. Fried chicken piled on a platter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: taps his finger on the empty plate in front of him and subtly checks his watch. JANINE(57) smooths out the embroidered table cloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and CHARLIE(39) tend to their child, REX(3). Rex repeatedly jams a finger into the potatoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's all join hands for the blessing. The SOUND of the front door opening. Samantha gets up and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis has Hannah in his arms. He closes the door. Samantha appears behind them. She speaks in a hushed, angry voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell have you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I'm sorry. I had to run an errand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're really late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't even bring your cell phone. Samantha heads back to the dining room. Curtis sucks his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Potatoes dalloped, chicken passed, the table is active with the family serving and eating. Curtis watches it all, somehow separated from it. He's exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Missed you at church this mornin' Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows what to do if he wants me to stop askin'. Curtis looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it a good service?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was. It was good work. Curtis nods. The family in front of him eats the meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking about cleaning up that storm shelter out back. They look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Light from the open closet door cuts a shape in the relatively dark hallway. Curtis roots through the back of the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: urtis sweeps the concrete floor of the storm shelter. A Coleman camping lantern sits on the wooden bench attached to the back wall. It casts an odd light up into the room. -Curtis places cans of food onto metal shelves. -Curtis flips through keys on his key ring. He adds the two small padlock keys to the ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha sits on the bed in her pajamas applying lotion to her legs. She wipes the remainder on her knuckles and looks at the empty spot on Curtis' side of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha walks into the kitchen and turns off the overhead light. She pauses, seeing something in the backyard. She stops at the back door and stares out at the storm shelter. The camp lantern's orange light glows through the open metal doors. She watches for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shelter has been cleaned up. The metal shelves hold canned food, water jugs and first aid supplies. Blankets and pillows are stacked on the other side of the room. Curtis sits in the back corner of the shelter on the wooden bench. He flips through one of the books from the library. The cover reads, "DREAM ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION". The book on mental illness sits by his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Doctor's Office is a converted one-story residential house. Curtis slouches in a faux leather chair grouped in the small reception area. He has nodded off. His head snaps up. He sucks air through his nose and sits up in his chair. He sees a WOMAN(25) reading a children's book aloud to her DAUGHTER(3) on a colorful rug in the corner. A door opens and a NURSE with a clipboard steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis? Curtis stands and follows the nurse out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sits, fully clothed, on the edge of a paper covered bench in the exam room. DOCTOR SHANNAN, an older man with a smoker's voice, enters smiling and gives a firm handshake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis, how you doin' bud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's my girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Doctor turns to a small table in the corner and grabs a wooden tongue depressor and an otoscope from a drawer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good to hear. Tilt your head back for me. The Doctor shines the otoscope into his nostrils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a cold. The Doctor pauses and turns to check a chart on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Did she get that down wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I just told her that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. So what's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been havin'...I've been having some trouble sleepin'. I was hopin' you could give me somethin' for it. Doctor Shannan takes a seat on a rolling stool and processes the request.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long's this been goin' on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `Bout four nights now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not sleepin' at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well some, but real restless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I think four nights is a little too soon to tell. My advice would be to not eat or drink anything after 8 o'clock at night. Cut back on any alcoholic drinks, tobacco, caffeine...get some daily exercise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I think... Curtis isn't sure how much he wants to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I may need to try some medication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reason I've been having trouble sleeping is because of some dreams I've been havin'. I didn't think it was anything at first, but then the other day I woke up and the bed was wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You urinated in your bed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Couple days before that I had a dream that my dog attacked me and it took all day for the pain in my arm to go away. Doctor Shannan leans his back against the table and thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been to see your mother lately? He swivels the stool around and writes on a prescription pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been about a month. He tears two sheets off and holds the first out to Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. This is a prescription for a pretty mild sedative. It's non- habit forming, but I'm only giving you enough for a few days anyway. Take it and see if it helps. In the meantime, (holds up the other slip) This is the number of a good friend of mine in Columbus. He's a psychiatrist. It's a drive, but he's the best I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give him a call and let him know you'll be down to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The construction site sits in the middle of open farmland but is considerably more involved than Curtis' last job site. Dump trucks, backhoes and cement mixers roll and beep across muddy ground. A 20 MAN CREW operates throughout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dewart pushes down a lever that activates the hydraulic lift for the drill. Curtis appears behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Dewart!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you say Curtis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much. Curtis kneels at the ground beside the rig. Sifts dirt through his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They want us to get a pilot hole drilled by lunch. I figure worse comes to worse we can eat on the rig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we'll get it done. Weekend all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Same old shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's lunchtime. The men sit around in different groups eating out of bagged lunches. Curtis eats a sandwich and watches the men. Some bitching. Others laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wind blows through a wooded area nearby. He watches the leaves move. He looks to the sky. It's a beautiful day. Almost peaceful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The insurance office sits in a row of small downtown buildings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) No. I need the name of the specialist whose diagnosis you'll accept.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An INSURANCE AGENT(62) sits behind her desk with the phone to her ear. She's an older woman wearing a pant suit. Samantha sits by a fake plant and sips a Coke. She watches Hannah play with building blocks from a plastic tub provided by the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) No. Look it. I've told you this twice. Please. Just get me the name and or the approval code. (BEAT) Okay. The Agent writes something down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) All right. And the phone. Well great. Thank you very much. The Agent hangs up the phone and rips a piece of paper from the pad in front of her. She hands it to Samantha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the name and number of the specialist who the insurance company approves of. Just call and make an appointment. Now if this doctor signs off , you should have the implant procedure fully covered. I'm sorry it took so long. Samantha looks at the paper, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I give you a hug?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine. It's fine. You know your husband's company actually has very good insurance when it kicks in. Not a lot of jobs offer policies half as good. You're very lucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stands in line at the pharmacy located in the back corner of the grocery store. He approaches the counter and hands over his prescription to a female PHARMACIST. She disappears behind a divider as Curtis removes his wallet. He takes out an insurance card and runs his thumb over the bills. The Pharmacist returns with a stapled white bag. Curtis holds out the insurance card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. We have your insurance on file. That'll be $47.64.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the co-pay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is your co-pay. Curtis studies the small paper sack and removes three, 20 dollar bills from his wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - EVENING Curtis enters the front door, closing it behind him. He turns and is met by Samantha, who wraps her arms around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. She squeezes him. Then kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have good news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis finishes off a dinner of roast and potatoes. Samantha sets the piece of paper the Insurance Agent gave her in front of him and begins clearing the table. Hannah draws on a piece of construction paper at the other end of the table. Samantha picks up a crayon and shows it to Hannah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Green? How `bout a red? She pretends to use the crayon as lipstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was like talking to a sane person for once. She made one phone call. That's it. I've been trying that 800 number for weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's great. It's great. (TO HANNAH) Hey, Hannah. Hannah doesn't look up. He stands and goes over to her. Touches her shoulder and kneels beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You excited? Huh? We're gonna get you some help. Curtis touches his finger to her chest then stops. He can't think of the sign. He turns to Samantha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you say...sign excited?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like this. Samantha shows him the sign. Curtis mimics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excited. Yeah? Hannah nods. He kisses her on the forehead. He picks up a crayon and holds it up to her lips like lipstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I got to do you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha lies under the covers looking at a real estate magazine. Curtis takes off his clothes by the dresser. He subtly removes a prescription bottle from his pants pocket and cups it in his palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, honey. Look at this one. It's a 2-1 and it sits directly on the beach. Wouldn't that be great? We wouldn't have to worry about Hannah crossing traffic. Curtis walks over and leans in to see the page. They are rental photos of beach condos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the rent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight ninety nine a week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds real nice. Samantha keeps flipping through the magazine as Curtis heads to the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis turns the water on in the sink and shakes two pills from the orange bottle. He stuffs them in his mouth and chases it with water from the faucet. Curtis looks at himself in the mirror for a moment before cutting out the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crack in the ceiling slowly comes into focus. Curtis sits up in bed, rubbing his eyes. He looks around the room. He hears Samantha in the kitchen. He takes a deep breath, smelling the breakfast cooking. Curtis smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sits at the kitchen table as Samantha dishes up some eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sleep well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like you're feeling better. Curtis nods and eats his breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis and Dewart attach a drill bit to the rig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to come there and do it for you? Jesus. Curtis steadies the large metal piece as Dewart ratchets it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how much food do you think you'd need to live on for a week?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean to stay alive. What do you think you'd need?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. You hear about people livin' for days all the time offa bark and melted snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never heard of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit I don't know. You asked the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's on there. It's on. Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis steps back from the arm of the drill. Dewart taps the wrench on two bolts to make sure they are secure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THUNDER. Curtis flinches at the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Curtis turns around and checks the sky. It's clear blue. Not a cloud in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds like thunder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sounds like thunder?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER THUNDER STRIKE. Curtis doesn't move. He watches Dewart walk to the controls of the drilling rig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROLLING NOW. Curtis steps back from the rig and checks the horizons. Nothing. It's a beautiful day. Dewart looks down at him. Curtis' face is pale, scared. Curtis looks at him. Not sure what to say. Curtis turns and walks to his truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you goin'? Curtis. Where you goin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stops and rests his hands on the bed of the truck. Another THUNDER STRIKE makes him flinch. Curtis VOMITS next to the back tire. He quickly stands, wiping his mouth. He checks over his shoulders to see if anyone has seen him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CURTIS' TRUCK/RURAL HIGHWAY - MOVING - DAY Curtis studies his face in the rearview mirror as he sails down the rural highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He rubs his eyes with the back of his hand and looks in the side mirror. The horizon is still clear. Curtis begins to hyperventilate. Short breaths accompanied by cold sweat. Sucking air. He can't breath. He panics. The truck tires slide on the gravel shoulder as he abruptly slams on the brakes and steers off the highway. Dust settles outside as Curtis begins to get his breathing under control. He rests his head on the steering wheel and shuts his eyes tight. Everything quiets down. His breathing. The road. No more thunder. Curtis looks out his passenger window. His truck has stopped in front of a Tractor Trailer Depot. A rusted shipping container with giant white letters painted on it reads, "CONTAINERS FOR SALE". Curtis stares at this. He climbs out of the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis walks around his truck to get a better look at the depot. The dirt lot is piled high with containers. He studies the "FOR SALE" sign, then a smaller sign next to it that lists available sizes. Curtis turns back to his truck and rubs his face, still shaking things off. He looks up at the sky. Clear and blue. A thought comes to him. He checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CURTIS' TRUCK/INTERSTATE - DAY Curtis drives down a divided four-lane interstate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis' truck pulls into the parking lot of the Pleasant Grove Apartments. It's a well manicured, new construction facility. The words "AN ASSISTED LIVING COMMUNITY" are written under the apartment name on the sign out front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stands by the door for apartment 212 in an interior carpeted hallway. He knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A passing ATTENDANT guides an elderly WOMAN down the hallway. Curtis nods to them. The door opens. SARAH(61), a plainly dressed woman much too young to live in a nursing home, looks surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Mom. Her eyes light up and she wraps her arms around Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. She leads him inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The apartment is small, but nicely kept. Not much furniture or personal trappings. Framed family photos mostly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to get some water. He fills his glass at the sink. Takes a sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Curtis enters the living area as Sarah stops in the kitchenette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah runs her fingers around the bent edges of a small photo of Hannah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't she lovely. Curtis drops his head. He looks uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to ask you somethin'. She looks at him. Totally open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember what year we brought you up here? To the first place. She has to think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was `86.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Because Kyle was going to be a senior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was 10.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Curtis nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you remember what happened before you got diagnosed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean...I just want to know how it all started. Before you had to leave. Sarah settles in her chair, understanding the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't know. I remember it was a real stressful time. Your father was gone a lot, and I couldn't handle things on my own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever have any dreams? Like bad dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nothing like that. There was always... (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (searches for the words) There was always a panic that took hold of me. I thought people were watching me or listening to me. I... Sarah is remembering. Her face draws tight, frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. It's all right. It's fine. Sarah looks up and smiles. Her focus shifts back to her son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah. I'm fine. Sarah looks back down to Hannah's photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The relatively new gas station sits just off the interstate. Curtis stands at the pump filling up his truck. He watches the numbers next to the dollar sign roll higher. He looks back at the busy freeway. Cars passing. The pump stops. The final amount reads, "$68.79". He hangs the hose back onto the pump and pulls a cell phone from his pocket. He dials and waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) May I have the number for Doctor George Shannan? (WAITS) Thanks. Curtis, phone still at his ear, turns and watches the horizon. The sun hangs low in the sky. A reddish haze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) Hi, is Doctor Shannan there? May I speak with him? This is Curtis LaForche. (WAITS) Hey Doc. Yeah, sorry...Sorry to call you at home, I just don't think I can make it to Columbus to see that psychiatrist. Yeah, it's just too far. Is there somewhere local you can send me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis steps quietly into the bedroom. The lights are on, but Samantha has fallen asleep on top of the made bed. He empties his pockets on the dresser and Samantha wakes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hey. Sorry I woke you up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. Where you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went to see mom. Samantha sits up in the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmm hmm. I just wanted to check up on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shoulda told me we would have gone with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. Samantha lays back down, tucking herself under the covers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will in a bit. Curtis finishes emptying his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah sleeps soundly in her bed. Curtis stands at the door watching her. He walks over and takes a seat on the edge of the bed. He listens to her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The backyard is almost pitch black. Curtis stands in front of the storm shelter doors holding out the Coleman Lantern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He surveys the backyard with it. The trash pile has been removed leaving the yard more open. Curtis begins to count steps out from the left edge of the shelter doors. He counts to himself, three feet per stride. He begins to outline a rectangle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house is quiet and the den is lit by a single lamp. Curtis sits alone on the couch, hunched over the coffee table. He writes on a yellow legal pad. It's a list with the heading, "REMODEL". It reads: -Shipping Container, $1,800
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $475 -Plumbing and waste, $1,650 -Bobcat, $1,750 -Jackhammer with pneumatics, $800 -Sealant, $150 -Dirt, -$250 At the bottom of the list, Curtis writes the figure, "$7,500" and circles it. He studies the number, then begins drawing a rectangular diagram below it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis blows into a Styrofoam cup and stares through the blinds of an office window. Outside, a flag snaps at the top of a pole next to the FIRST NATIONAL BANK sign. He looks down at a NEWSPAPER laid out on an end table next to him. He flips it over and studies the ads on the back. A big one in the corner catches his eye. It reads, "CUYAHOGA GUN AND KNIFE SHOW!" The ad lists items for sell/trade: ...Tactical Gear, Gas Masks, Batons... Curtis focuses in on the words "Gas Masks" and tears the ad out. JOHN MYERS(34) enters with a set of papers in his hand. Curtis quickly tucks the ad into his back pocket. Myers takes a seat in one of two chairs in front of his desk and looks over the papers. He takes a pen out of his pocket as Curtis sits down next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you've kept up with the payments on the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been good about that. Myers nods, but he carries a look of concern. He confides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta tell you Curtis, banks aren't loaning money the way they used to. We've got you a loan today, but the interest rates are variable and we have to tie it to your house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine. Myers sits back, drawing the pen to his lips and tapping it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis, I've known you a long time. We financed your house for you, two vehicles. I'm telling you this is a risky loan you're taking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need the money John. Myers nods, then leans forward and clicks the pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis opens the door to his truck which is parked in the bank's lot. He unbuttons his starched white shirt and places it on the truck seat. He pulls out a dirty blue work shirt and begins buttoning it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dewart sits at the controls of the drilling rig. He sees Curtis approaching through the construction site. Curtis waves two fingers at him. Dewart shuts down the drill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I left you yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dewart hops down and the two approach the drill site. Dewart seems sullen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim came by. I covered for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help with the depth charts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis and Dewart sit on the drilling rig eating lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckin' Nat put me in charge of frying oysters for that Lions Club supper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need another burner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, if you still got yours I could use it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you could help me with somethin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta you need?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna build out the tornado shelter in my backyard. I could use some help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell you wanna do that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just needs to be done. Dewart eyes him, unsure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you need?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figure I'll do it on Saturday, borrow some equipment from work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need a backhoe, a hauler. I'll rent the rest. Dewart stares off into the distance. He notices Curtis looking at him, waiting for an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Whatever. I'll help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't wanna see you fuck up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stands and talks with a MAN in the middle of the Tractor Trailer Depot just off the highway. The Man points to a row of shipping containers and uses his hands to mimic how one would be lowered. They shake hands and Curtis walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Community Health Center is a one-level, aged brick building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sits in the lobby filling out a clipboard full of forms and questionnaires. Light traffic flows in and out. He flips a page over. The section heading reads, "Family Medical History". Curtis begins to write.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis references a slip of paper as he looks for a room number in a long, linoleum tiled hallway; a book and note pad tucked under his arm. He finds the correct door ajar and knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , a black woman with short hair, sits behind a public issue desk in a public issue office. A poster about flu shots hangs on the wall. There is no personal decor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. She half stands and offers a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a seat. I'm Kendra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis. Curtis shakes and they sit. Kendra opens a manila folder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna start by askin' you some questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I already answered all the questions on the forms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know. I looked at `em, but I need to get a profile started on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Well... Curtis slides the yellow legal pad out of the book he brought. It's the library book on Mental Illness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of the five possible symptoms needed to be diagnosed with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reads off the pad) delusions, hallucinations, disorganized speech, disorganized behavior, and the negative symptoms, I've had two. Delusions and hallucinations. But they say it has to continue for six months to be diagnosed schizophrenia and mine hasn't been goin' on anywhere near that long. So, I took this quiz in the back of the book and I scored a five out of a possible twenty. Schizophrenia starts at twelve. So, they say it might be a... (reads off the pad) brief psychotic disorder. Whatever it is, I need to know what to do or what to get on to get this thing under control. Kendra stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. I'm a counselor. Certified, but I'm not a psychiatrist. I can't prescribe anything to you. I can talk to you, I can recommend where to send you, but that's it. Curtis begins to gather his things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that said, if you want to talk, I'll listen. For a lot of people that's a good start. Curtis hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you said here that your mother was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia in her thirties. And you're at 35. You wanna talk about that? Curtis settles in his seat. Sets his book on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I don't know my mother's symptoms. I was just 10. My brother was 17. And, uh...I don't know. She just left me in the car in the parking lot at the grocery store one day. And she didn't come back. And then they found her a week later eatin' trash out of a dumpster in northern Kentucky. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad had to put her in the state hospital in Columbus. And she's been in assisted living ever since. Yep. My dad raised me. He died last April. Kendra nods, a pleasant look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell me `bout these dreams. Curtis studies her face, bites at the inside of his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The class has finished. PARENTS and KIDS trickle out. Samantha stands off to the side speaking with the Teacher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what our schedule will be, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all right. But I really do think you should continue with the sign language. And any additional therapies that kids need for the cochlear implant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. As Samantha talks to the Teacher, Curtis looks over flashcards with Hannah. He signs "SUNSHINE", a circle in the sky with the hand then coming down, fingers spread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAMANTHA'S CAR/INTERSTATE - NIGHT Curtis drives while Samantha and Hannah sleep in the back. Surrounding farmland drops quickly into darkness joining a purple sky in the distance. Through the passenger window, a streak of lightning breaks across the horizon. Then another. Curtis, seeing this, repositions to get a better look through the window. It's horizontal lightning that appears to leap from cloud to cloud. Well defined bolts that strobe the night sky silhouetting towering thunderheads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis looks back to Samantha and Hannah, still asleep. He pulls the car over to the shoulder of the interstate and continues watching. He climbs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cars rush by as Curtis gently closes the car door. Keeping his eyes on the lightning storm, he walks to the shoulder. It's a fantastic display of light. Hurried and intense. A BOLT of lightning reaches down to the ground. Sparks pop off the earth in the distance. Another BOLT streaks down, getting closer. Curtis sees the traffic continuing to pass by at full speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is anyone seeing this? Curtis walks to the back window of the car and sees Samantha sleeping inside. He reaches out to knock but stops himself. He turns back to the lightning and watches.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ON THE SHOULDER OF THE INTERSTATE,

direction.raw_text: The giant rolling door curls up in the Delta Agri-Pro warehouse. Sunlight bounces off the finished concrete. Curtis pulls the chain for the door as Dewart slams the tow latch down on the back of a DUMP TRUCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FLEA MARKET/LAFORCHE HOME - SERIES OF IMAGES - DAY -The Dump Truck and Tow Trailer sit parked on the street in front of Curtis' house. Dewart stands at the back of the trailer with his hand on the ramp lever as Curtis reverses a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: onto the street. -Samantha works her booth at the flea market. Hannah neatly organizes a collection of colored beads on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: foot rectangle has been outlined in bright orange paint next to the storm shelter in Curtis' backyard. Other colored markings denote gas and water lines. The bucket on the Backhoe digs into the center of the dotted rectangle. -Dewart maneuvers the Backhoe's bucket and drops a load of earth into the bed of the Dump Truck. Red, the dog, barks at the loud machinery from his pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . -Curtis uses a smaller trench digging machine on the backside of the yard, radiating out from the main dig site. He notices a NEIGHBOR watching him from they yard next door. -Samantha tallies cash from the tackle box she uses as a register. Hannah counts out the change. -Dewart assembles a series of PVC pipe next to the trenches Curtis dug. -Curtis, work goggles on, stands in a head deep hole holding a pneumatic jack hammer up to the exposed exterior wall of the storm shelter. He begins hammering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - LATE AFTERNOON Samantha's car pulls up and parks on the opposite side of the street from their house. She gets out, puzzled by the Backhoe and Trailer parked in front of her house. Huge light brown tracks of dirt stripe the concrete driveway. Leading Hannah by the hand, Samantha follows the tracks to the backyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha stops, mouth agape, stunned by what she sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: foot by 8 foot wide hole that is 10 feet deep sits in the middle of her yard. Smaller trenches lead out from it. Dewart leans against the propane tank in the back corner of the yard. He digs dirt from underneath his fingernails with a pocket knife. Seeing Samantha, he waves a hand. Curtis' head appears from the hole. He stops when he sees Samantha. They stare at one another. He can see her surprise. He continues up the ladder and walks over to her. Dewart watches from the back of the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. It's all right. Calm down. Samantha takes Hannah into the house without saying a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you out of your mind? She continues into the house. Curtis turns, frustrated. Dewart takes this in, then goes back to his nails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - NIGHT Hannah watches television in the den by herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha sits on the edge of the bed. Curtis stands a few paces back. His hands dug into the back of his dusty jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a word. You didn't say one word about this to me. Don't you think you owe me that? Don't you think that you might respect me enough to at least consider what I had to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want you worryin' about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'm worried Curtis. How are you paying for all that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a home improvement loan from the bank. Samantha is stunned. She stands and gets in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you do that without talking to me? You know the expenses we have comin' up. You want to waste money on a stupid tornado shelter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doin' it...I'm doin' it for us. I know you don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. I don't understand. I don't understand half the stuff you've been doin' lately. I don't understand you puttin' Red out back. I don't understand you stayin' up all night in that stupid tornado shelter. You don't come to bed half the time. You leave and don't tell me where you're goin'. Explain that to me. Please. Tell me something that helps me understand why you're bein' like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis can't look at her. He tries to find words but fails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothin' to explain. Samantha stares at his face, searching for an answer. She's on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna go put Hannah to bed. Curtis walks out of the room. Samantha can't hold back, tears run down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stares at himself in the mirror. He opens the bottle of prescription pills and shakes out two. Looks at them. Shakes out another three. He pops the pills in his mouth and drinks from the faucet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's dark and quiet in the house. Samantha sleeps on her side, her back to Curtis. Her head is jostled. More. The bed begins to vibrate. Her eyes open. She turns over to see Curtis. He's having a SEIZURE. Samantha reaches for him. Eyes closed, his body convulses violently. Samantha quickly turns on a bedside lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis! She touches his arms. A small amount of BLOOD begins to trickle from both sides of his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby. Oh, my God. Baby...Oh, my God. Baby. Samantha jumps off the bed and grabs a cordless phone on the dresser. She dials, watching her husband continue to shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need an ambulance! My husband's having a seizure. 41800 Tindale Road. Hurry up. He's bleeding! Samantha goes over to him. Holding her hands out, cautious to touch him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) Okay. Okay. Samantha puts the phone receiver down on the nightstand. The Operator's VOICE still coming through. She touches his arm. Suddenly, the seizures stop. Curtis' body is still. Samantha freezes. His eyes open and he thrashes up in bed. Samantha jumps, tripping and stumbling backward. Curtis sucks short breaths into his lungs. His head darts back and forth, eyes wild. He sees Samantha staring up at him from the floor. He begins to calm down. Curtis touches his mouth. Sees the blood there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey? Samantha stands up and goes over to him. She sits on the edge of the bed and touches his arm. She's scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey? Are you okay? Curtis slowly nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were having a seizure. I called an ambulance. Curtis sees the phone on the nightstand and grabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) No. It's fine. It's fine. Don't send an ambulance. It's fine. Curtis clicks off the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? Curtis wraps his arms around her. He holds her tight. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of ambulance sirens approach from the distance. Samantha speaks, her voice trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby what's goin' on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - NIGHT The ambulance lights splash across the house. Curtis escorts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EMTs down the front walk. He favors his left leg, walking with a slight limp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry you fellows had to come all the way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what we do. Now we can still take you in if you want a doctor to look at those cuts in your mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. That's all right.. I'll see somebody on Monday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Curtis shakes their hands. He turns to walk back in the house and notices NEIGHBORS watching from their porches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis turns up a bottle of peroxide and swishes it in his mouth. It burns. He spits into the kitchen sink. Samantha sits at the table watching him. Concerned, scared. She holds a balled up tissue in her hand. Curtis takes a seat across the table. She waits for him to say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't been honest with you. I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's goin' on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been havin' these dreams. I guess they're more like nightmares. It's why I've been actin' like this. Samantha listens with a furrowed brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They always start with a kind of storm. Like a real powerful storm. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And there's always this dark, thick rain. Like fresh motor oil. And then the things, people, it just makes `em crazy. They attack me. Sometimes they go after Hannah. First one I had Red nearly chewed through my arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why you put him out back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was the dream? Tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was Dewart. We were at the job site. The storm started and somethin' happened. His face. His eyes were different. He came after me with a pick ax. And we fought. And he ran it through my leg. Curtis zones out for a moment. Samantha says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hard to explain, because it's not just a dream. It's a feeling. I'm afraid something might be comin'. Something that's...not right. I can not describe it. I just need you to believe me. Samantha's eyes are red. Her nose. She nods slightly and dabs the tissue at the corner of her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been to a counselor. I've seen her a few times. This makes Samantha look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I come from. And I promised myself...I promised myself I would never leave. And I am doin' everything that I can to make that true. The room is quiet. Samantha watches her husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah lies flat as the sled moves her through the oval CT scanner. A red, lighted crosshair passes over her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha has Hannah on her lap. She and Curtis listen intently to an ATTENDANT who sits next to them with a file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since the doctor's approved her for surgery, We just need to get her scheduled. The next possible opening is... (reviews a calendar) The 21st of next month. That's six weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six weeks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stands with Russell over the hood of a pick-up truck. They look over a roll of ground water charts. Russell talks and points to the map, but Curtis' attention is focused elsewhere. He watches Dewart in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...this point just to the west. I don't think we'll have any problem. We should be able to get twenty, maybe thirty in this next week. But we're looking to see how that's gonna shape up, so... Dewart smiles and makes broad gestures with his arms. He's telling a story to Dave, who laughs hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis? His attention snaps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. That sounds good. We'll get it done. Russell rolls up the charts. They walk toward the work site, toward Dewart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim fills out paperwork at his desk. There is a KNOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. Curtis walks inside. He stands in front of the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you need Curtis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a favor Jim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you take Dewart off my crew? Just reassign him someplace else. Jim sets his pen down and leans back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the trouble? He not pullin' his weight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, nothin' like that. He's a good worker. He's a good man. He's my friend. I think it'd be easier not being in charge of someone I'm so close to. Jim nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I understand. This is part of what it means to manage people Curtis. You're gonna have to learn that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. I appreciate that but... well it would just be very helpful in this case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Well, I can put him with Russell. Anybody else you prefer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Whoever you think's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Curtis turns to leave the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been missin' a lotta work Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. My daughter's had a lot of doctor's visits. I haven't let anything get behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But don't. Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir. Curtis shows himself out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun has just set and a purple hue hangs over everything. Curtis stands in the very back of the yard and watches a MAN guide a long, flatbed trailer up the driveway. An 18 foot metal SHIPPING CONTAINER rides on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nat and Samantha sit at the kitchen table going over a list of food in a note pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know they just usually do oysters and fries but what if we did something healthier on the side?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What like slaw? Nat gets up to refill her drink. She looks out the back door and surveys the construction zone. A FORKLIFT lowers the Shipping Container into the giant hole in the backyard. Nat shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Maybe a vegetable or salad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dewart's been tellin' me how strange Curtis has been actin' lately. I am so sorry. Nat brings her drink back to the table and sits. Samantha doesn't look up from her pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not like you don't have enough on your plate with Hannah. Nat puts her hand on Samantha's. Samantha moves it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things are fine. We're fine. Nat smiles sympathetically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis meanders inside. He sees police tactical and survival gear behind the counter. Chief among them is a collection of gas masks hanging on the rear partition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Can I look at one of these gas masks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Which one you want to look at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The newest one. The OWNER of the store removes a mask and hands it to him. Curtis fiddles with the mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One seventy eight. Curtis frowns at the price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything cheaper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That's the cheapest one I got in the store. They go all the way up to two ninety. I don't know what you want to spend but a gas mask ain't something you want to go cheap on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got any kids sizes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Kids can't wear those. They got a have a special thing, its like a hood. I don't fool with those. Curtis nods. The perusing Shopper listens in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Ring me up a couple of `em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stands at the driver's door of his pick-up. The box sits on the seat in front of him. He opens it and removes one of the gas masks. He stares into its vacant plastic eyes. He drops the mask back into the box and shakes his head. Sighs, frustrated with it all. He checks over his shoulder, scans the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis stands on top of the shipping container that rests in the hole roughly a foot below the yard. Wearing tinted goggles, he cuts a circular hole in the top of the container with a small blowtorch. The sparks stop and Curtis raises the goggles to inspect his work. He kicks at the weld with the heel of his boot and the metal falls into the container.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He sets down the torch and removes a roof turbine vent from a cardboard box and holds it up next to the newly cut hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) What the hell are you doin'? Curtis smiles to himself. He turns to find KYLE(42) standing at the edge of the hole. His hands are tucked into the back of his jeans and he's sizing up the work. Curtis steps off the roof of the shipping container onto ground level. He holds out a hand and Kyle shakes it, never taking his eyes off the unfinished shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got goin' on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just addin' on to the storm shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just `cause. Kyle notices the PVC piping running in the trenches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You runnin' water to it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah. From our well. Runnin' sewer out to the city line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you spendin' on this thing?
direction.name: direction
