direction.raw_text: It's not bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't look it. Curtis shrugs. Kyle sees his reluctance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take your eye off the ball one minute in this economy and you're screwed. You got the cash for this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't put nothin' on credit cards. That shit'll eat you up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not. Kyle is staring him down. Curtis just looks at the shelter. There's a long silence shared between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha called me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figured. Curtis climbs back onto the shipping container and continues installing the roof vent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Called you to come tell me to quit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She called `cause she's worried. Says you've been stressed out. Curtis doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stressed out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No more than anybody else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, huh...Hey, look. You wanna come by and have dinner sometime, Kyle. That's fine. We'll have a beer and talk about the old days, but you got somethin' to say just say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stop that shit right now. I'll come over there and remind you what it feels like to get your ass whipped. Curtis keeps his head down, scolded. Kyle relents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just coming here to check on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I appreciate it Kyle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been to see Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. A few days ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should see her. Take your girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I'll get around to it. There's an awkward moment as Curtis works with his back to Kyle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need a hand? Curtis turns and looks up at him. Shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I've got it. Kyle nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Call me if you need me okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. Kyle looks at him for a moment. He turns and walks toward the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Kyle? Kyle turns back. Curtis climbs onto the yard and walks over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually you could do me a favor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still looking for a dog?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Kyle looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis slaps down the tailgate to Kyle's truck, which is parked in the driveway. Red, tail wagging, hops up into the bed. Curtis closes the tailgate and sets a leash and two bowls into the back of the truck. Curtis rubs Red behind the ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got a good spot for you, okay bud. Kyle stands at the passenger door to the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it'll make my girls happy. All right. Kyle walks around the truck to the driver's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Kyle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Kyle stops. Curtis walks up and hugs him. Kyle slaps him on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care of yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. All right. I will little brother. You take care of your family. Handle your business. Okay? Curtis nods. Kyle smiles, shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Kyle climbs into the truck and cranks it. Curtis steps back as he pulls away. Red looks back from the bed of the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah, fresh from the tub, stands to let Curtis rub her wet head with a towel. He finishes and stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Bedtime. Hannah looks up at him. Curtis signs his hand like a pillow then touches his watch. They move out of the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sits on the edge of his bed staring at the window in their room. He's already dressed for work. He watches as the thick, dark rain hits the window and streaks. He has a curious look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , past the den.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , into the kitchen. Curtis stops at the entry to the kitchen. Samantha, wearing a robe, stands with her back to him. She's cooking something at the stove. Curtis notices the back door standing open. HARD RAIN slants down outside. He looks down at the tile floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: track inside. They lead to where Samantha is standing. She turns to him. She's pale with a vacant look on her face. Her hair is soaking wet. Curtis looks at her, concerned. She stares back, emotionless. She slowly looks down at the counter next to her. A kitchen knife rests there. Curtis looks at the knife. They look at one another again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sits at the breakfast table across from Hannah. He looks over at Samantha. She cooks, her back to him. Hannah climbs out of her chair and goes to look out the back door. Samantha turns and dishes eggs onto Curtis' plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? She touches his hand. Curtis FLINCHES. Their eyes meet. He wants to take it back, and she can see that. It begins to sink in for her. Hannah vocalizes something behind them. Samantha looks at her husband, shakes her head in disbelief. Hannah makes another sound, pounds on the back door. Samantha turns and sees a MAN standing in their backyard. She flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that? Curtis stands to see out the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim, Curtis' boss, stands with his hands on his hips looking down at the planted shipping container. Curtis approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Jim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis. Dewart told me you took equipment from work for a project at your house. Said that's why you wanted him off your crew. I came out here to see it myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It was just a hauler and a backhoe. It was Saturday. I had `em back in less than 8 hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that doesn't matter. I can't even tell you how many rules you broke. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if you had an accident? Huh? What if you ran somebody over on your way out here? Lawsuit like that could bankrupt me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm sorry Jim. I hadn't thought of that. Thank God nothin' like that happened. You know? I'll do whatever I can to make it right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can pick up your last check on Friday. You've got two weeks benefits. Curtis nods. Accepts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you fire Dewart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's on two weeks leave unpaid... I'm sorry Curtis. You did this to yourself. Jim turns and walks out of the backyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha clears the table. Hannah sits, watching her father walk in. Curtis stops just inside the door, closes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been fired. Samantha continues clearing the dishes to the sink. She doesn't look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the health insurance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We get two more weeks. Samantha slams the plates into the sink. They break. She holds her head back and stares at the ceiling. She walks over to Curtis...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... ...and SLAPS him across the face. Hannah begins to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Samantha turns and collects Hannah from the table. She grabs her things and walks out of the house. Curtis stands alone in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis walks down the hallway to Kendra's office. The door ajar, he knocks and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis finds ANDY(42), a man in khakis and a button up, sitting behind the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, `scuse me. Andy rises from his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you Curtis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. Kendra transferred out. I'll be meeting with you today. Curtis looks at the man. He's kind of mincing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, sit down. Curtis takes a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to Kendra?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She got into a program at OSU so she'll be transferring near there. I've split her case load with another counselor. It's been kind of crazy around here lately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I've looked over your file. It says your mother was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia in her early thirties. Let's start there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis looks at the man for a moment, then stands and walks out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis' truck is parked in the driveway with the hood up and the engine running. Curtis stands over the vibrating engine, studying it. He looks at the belts. He watches them move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis hefts a porcelain toilet down the steps of the shelter. A dull light glows through the new entryway that's been knocked out through the back left wall. Curtis goes through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sets the toilet on the floor. He picks up the camping lantern and holds it up to the space. The lack of light makes it feel more cavernous than it is. Two cots have been brought down as well as an assortment of supplies. Canned food, a small gas burner. Curtis hangs the lantern onto a hook on the wall and goes about connecting the toilet to a pipe sticking out of the back corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - DAY Samantha walks inside followed by Hannah and a WOMAN from the flea market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry. I completely forgot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. Don't worry about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. I hope you like them. Samantha hands over the plastic bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. I brought cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's terrific. It's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Samantha takes three twenties from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me if they don't work and I'm sorry again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's okay. Thank you. Samantha closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha takes the tin decorated with ocean creatures down from the fridge. She removes the envelope with the word
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: written on it and takes out a stack of bills. She folds the bills over and stuffs them into her purse before placing the empty envelope back in the tin. She looks out back and sees Curtis sitting with Hannah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shipping container has been covered over with dirt. Two rotating vents spin at either end of the brown mound. Curtis sits on the freshly packed dirt signing with Hannah. He signs something that makes her laugh. Hannah smacks a muddy clump between her hands. Curtis touches her nose, leaving a dirt smudge. Hannah laughs. She touches his face, smudging it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha watches through the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha tucks Hannah into bed. She kisses her on the head and turns out the bedside lamp. Samantha leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha steps out of the house. She walks over to Curtis, who is standing on a grassy section of the yard over an assortment of auto parts. They don't speak for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the alternator from the truck. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just trying to figure out a way to charge enough batteries to run lights down there. Ah, what the hell? Maybe I'll hook it up to your old exercycle. Samantha almost smiles. Curtis keeps his eyes on the parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna leave me? Samantha looks at his hands. They hang by his sides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You flinched when I touched your hand this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in one of your dreams? Curtis nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you deal with that? He holds open his hand to her. She takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Then I made a decision. We cancel the beach trip. We have enough to cover bills for the next two months with your last check. I'm going to get a job. You're gonna find another job. I'm going to call to see if we can move Hannah's surgery up. We'll need to see what it costs to extend your policy to the end of the year. I want you to see a psychiatrist. Not a counselor from the free clinic. Someone good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Shannan gave me the number of somebody. But, uh, I just don't think we can afford it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll find the money. Also, the Lions Club supper's this weekend. I want you to come with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to see any of those people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to go. I need to do something normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Curtis nods. Samantha let's go of his hand and walks back to the house. Curtis goes back to studying the auto parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The inside of the club is a musty banquet hall with wood panelled walls and a drop tile ceiling. The place is packed. Rows of folding tables fill the center of the room. A long
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has formed along the side wall that wraps to a serving station at the back. Heated metal bins filled with fried oysters and french fries. Curtis gets in line with his family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis holds two paper plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many pieces does Hannah get?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just one. Curtis uses tongs to grab pieces of fried oyster. Looking up, he can see back through the kitchen to an open door outside. Dewart stands there over a butane fired frying pot. He wears an apron and stares at Curtis. Curtis moves down the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lewis sits with Cammie and their baby. He laughs and talks with another man. From a different table, Russell leans over to eye Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis sits at a table with his family. He loads Hannah's plate up with ketchup. A tap on his shoulder. Curtis turns to find Dewart standing over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doin' here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not here man. Dewart taps him on the shoulder again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said what are you doin' here. Curtis stands and Dewart takes a step back. The general noise of the place starts to quiet down as people take notice. A few stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told people what you been doin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cut me loose. Everything we been through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I'm sorry. Dewart shoves him in the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't fucking sorry. You sorry you wouldn't cut me loose. We fuckin' friends! This how you treat friends? Curtis places a hand on Dewart's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Dewart punches Curtis in the face. It stings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God dammit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Samantha gathers Hannah and moves back. Dewart shoves Curtis across the table. Oysters and bottles go everywhere. The entire room is on its feet watching. Curtis slips getting up. Dewart walks around the table, heading for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Curtis stands and kicks Dewart in the knee. It buckles back and he's on the floor. He cries out and grabs the twisted joint. He's done. Curtis paces over him, covered in ketchup and soda. He shouts down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! GOD DAMNIT! He wipes at his face. Sees all of the people staring at him. Addresses them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm crazy?! Huh! Is that what he told you! Curtis TURNS OVER A TABLE. He points to the gawking crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, listen up! There is a storm comin' like nothing you have ever seen. And not a one of you is prepared for it. (PACING) You think I'm crazy? I'M TALKIN' TO YOU RUSSELL! (PACING)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! You think I'm a thief? Hannah watches. THE SOUND MUTED. She looks on as Curtis paces, pointing and yelling, red faced at the crowd. Curtis backs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep well in your beds. Cause if this thing comes true, there ain't gonna be any more. Curtis looks down at Dewart. He turns to see Hannah. She's tucked under her Mother's leg crying. This hits him hard. He stops. Looking at Samantha, his eyes fill with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Samantha, leading Hannah by the hand, walks to Curtis. He stares at her, on the verge of breaking down. She takes her hand and gently pulls his head down to her shoulder. Without another look toward the crowd, Samantha leads her family out of the dining hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFORCHE HOME - DAY Hannah stands on a toolbox and rests her elbows on the side of Curtis' truck. The hood is open. She watches her father fiddle with re-installing the alternator. His fingers covered in grease. Hannah steps down from the toolbox and walks into the front yard. Curtis pauses, hearing a high-pitched, warbling SOUND in the distance. He notices Hannah is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah? He pulls his head out from the hood and sees Hannah standing on the curb. She looks down the street. He runs down his driveway, wiping his hands on a rag and watching the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hannah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flying in intricate geometric patterns, swarm above the house at the end of the street. They twist and bend into speckled black shapes. Hannah, watching, walks into the street. Curtis catches her by the hand. He turns away from the birds to see a STORM CELL building on the opposite horizon. He scoops Hannah into his arms, stepping back from it. The SOUND of the birds grows louder. Curtis pivots to find the mass of birds barreling down the street toward him. He turns away as the wall of birds crash past him. The force so powerful it knocks him backward. He covers Hannah's head, dodging the onslaught of wind and wings. The Flock passes. Curtis stands, his face cut and scraped. Hannah cries, clinging to his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The windshield of a car parked next to him SHATTERS. Curtis looks at the broken glass. A dead bird, it's neck broken, rests crumpled on the hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Another bird crashes into the asphalt just in front of him. Then another. Curtis looks up. The Flock of birds are circling overhead and diving down at him. More birds crashing to the ground. Curtis covers his head. The neighborhood's tornado SIRENS begin to sound. Curtis rushes Hannah toward his front door as dozens of birds plummet from the sky. The sirens BLARING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis wakes to Samantha shaking him by the shoulders. She's nearly on top of him in the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis! Wake up! Wake up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: continue to scream throughout the neighborhood. Curtis looks to the window. Rain and hail are battering the house. He jumps to his feet and grabs Samantha by the arm. They rush out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis bursts into the room. Hannah is standing at the window looking out. Curtis scoops her up, scaring her. She begins to cry as they run from the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wind blows fiercely as pellets of hail bounce off the ground. Rain cuts at a sharp angle. The Tornado Sirens continue. Curtis, Hannah in his arms and Samantha close behind, exits the back of the house and heads to the storm shelter. He passes Hannah to Samantha and fumbles with the padlock keys. At the doors to the shelter, Samantha holds her robe up to shield Hannah from the hail. Curtis gets the lock and opens the door. They go inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis slams the doors behind them. It's pitch black until he gets to the switch on the lantern. The room fills with the orange glow as Curtis snaps the padlock through the door handles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. It's okay. Curtis leads them through the entry to the larger section of the shelter. Samantha takes Hannah and sits with her on one of the cots. She's signing to her, trying to calm her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. All right. Come on. Sit down. Curtis goes to a trunk in the corner and begins rooting through it. He removes two gas masks and an oxygen mask connected to a small tank. He goes over and kneels in front of Hannah. He tries slipping the oxygen mask over her face. Samantha grabs his wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Don't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. It's oxygen. Here. Put this on. Curtis hands Samantha a gas mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please just do it. Okay? He looks to Hannah and places an oxygen mask over her face..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There we go. All right. Keep it out of your eyes. Okay? He signs to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. I love you. It's okay. Curtis eases on the knob at the top of the tank. He climbs onto the cot and puts his arm around them. He slips on his gas mask. Samantha is hesitant. She looks at her husband in the mask and leans back against the side of the container. Hannah looks up at her. She touches her mother's mask. Samantha slips on the gas mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The camping lantern on the floor casts long shadows up. The faint boom of thunder rolls softly outside. The family sits huddled together on the cot, wearing their masks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of thunder rattles the shelter. Curtis snaps awake, still wearing his gas mask. Samantha has climbed on the other cot and is asleep. Hannah sleeps under Curtis' arm. He gently lays her down on the cot and stands to stretch. He walks into the original section of the shelter and grabs a small flashlight off the metal shelving. He clicks it on and moves over to the concrete steps. He takes a seat and listens. He places his hand onto the metal door. A BOOM of thunder. He can hear the rain and wind blowing outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha rubs Curtis' shoulder, gently waking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake up babe. Curtis' head moves. He sees that Samantha and Hannah have removed their masks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your mask?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We took them off. It's fine. Take it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Curtis hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're fine. Take it off. Curtis slips the mask off his face. Worried, he takes a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to open the door now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis doesn't move. He looks at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it's...What if it's not over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it's not over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over. Get the keys. Open the door. Curtis slowly gets to his feet. He sees the dark entryway to the original section of the shelter. Taking the lantern, he walks to it. Samantha and Hannah follow. Curtis stops just inside. He holds the lantern up, illuminating the padlocked metal doors. He looks back at his family, then climbs the steps. He places his hand on the door. He flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's still storming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can hear it. Samantha stares at him. The room is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't hear anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put your hand on the door. You can feel it. He takes Samantha's wrist and guides her to the doors. He watches her face as she places a hand against the metal. She looks at him, her eyes getting red, and shakes her head "no". Curtis kneels in front of Hannah and mimics the signs from earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (signing and speaking) Thunder? Do you feel it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He flinches again. Looks to the ceiling
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (signing and speaking) You feel it? You feel it? Hannah walks to her mother. Samantha holds onto her. Curtis steps back from them. They watch him, their backs to the doors. He flinches and covers his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby, there's no storm outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Samantha walks over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis. I wouldn't lie to you. We love you very much. Please open the door. Curtis is on the verge of tears. He slowly reaches into his jeans pocket. He removes the keys. He holds them out to Samantha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I can't. Samantha looks at the keys, then at Curtis. Tears shake from his trembling face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, but if I open the door, then nothin's gonna change. You'll see that everything's fine, but nothing will change. Please. This is what it means to stay with us. This is something you have to do. He looks at Hannah, then Samantha. Curtis steadies himself, trying to control his flinching. He wipes his face with the back of his hands and takes a deep breath. Curtis walks toward the doors. On the steps, he reaches up to the padlock. The keys shake in his fingers. He turns to Samantha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you move Hannah back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Samantha picks Hannah up in her arms and Curtis watches them retreat to the rear wall. He goes back to the lock. He inserts the key. The padlock pops open. Curtis removes it. He looks back at Samantha, then flings open the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's blinding. Curtis holds his hand up to cover his eyes. He stares up at a crystal blue sky. Samantha watches as Curtis steps out of the shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis rises through the storm shelter's entryway. Out of the corner of his eye he catches,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis is startled. He turns to see a CREW of MEN from the power company hoisting a ladder onto the pole at the corner of the house. A power line dangles overhead. He turns to see NEIGHBORS in their yards clearing debris. Leaves and branches clutter the ground. The aftermath of a storm. Samantha steps out of the shelter holding Hannah. She surveys the damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine. She walks over to Curtis and hugs him. He kisses Samantha on the head. Curtis looks up at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis sits with Samantha in the plush office of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis rubs his hand over the soft leather upholstery on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any vacation time that you could use?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a job right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I know that times are hard, but I think it's really important for you to separate yourself from that storm shelter. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you need to break away from it for awhile. We can start you on some medication that I think will help, but that action alone would mean a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We usually go on a trip to Myrtle Beach every summer. We were gonns go this month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that would be okay if we start the medication now. It would give you all some time to prepare as a family, but I want to be clear, when Curtis gets back he'll need to take more time than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean that he'll need hands on therapy at a real facility. Curtis looks up for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean I have to leave my family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you need to seriously commit to some treatment. Curtis processes this. Samantha takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis scoops handfuls of sand out of a foot deep hole on the beach. He slops the wet mixture into a castle shaped bucket, his back to the shoreline of gentle, breaking waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (signing and speaking) Hey. Good, huh? Hannah sits on her knees in front of Curtis sprinkling dry sand over castle shaped mounds already formed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha drops four hotdogs into a boiling pot of water and stirs a bubbling pot of canned chili.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The beach condo is small, but brightly furnished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wooden deck hangs off the back of the beach condo. A picnic table is set with plastic place mats and forks. WIND lifts the corner of a stack of napkins. The wind blows harder, fanning the napkins off the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis, still working in the sand, puts a top on the sand castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. We put a top on it. Curtis smooths out the sand in the castle shaped bucket and turns it over to top off their sand mound. He hands the bucket over for Hannah to refill. The SOUND of the waves behind them has STOPPED. They don't notice. Curtis takes two fingers and digs a small trench around the sand castle. Curtis looks up ready to sign the letters but sees Hannah staring at the water. She looks at him and signs something with her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it honey? Curtis misses it. He shakes his head, "no", and Hannah signs again, slowly: "S-T-O-R-M".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Curtis turns to the shoreline, getting to his feet. He looks down at Hannah, who watches, mesmerized. Scared, she looks to her father. He grabs her under the arms and rests her on his hip. She buries her head into his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gust of wind greets Samantha as she walks out onto the deck holding a plate of hotdogs and a bowl of chili. She stops, seeing the horizon. Her mouth falls open. She slowly sets the plate and bowl down on the table, her mind racing. She looks down at Curtis in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Curtis looks up to the Condo and makes eye contact. He studies her face. Samantha looks at her husband, trying to process it all. She looks out at the horizon then back down to Curtis. Concern on her face, she nods to him. Curtis sees her nod. Samantha's eyes, still locked on Curtis, soften, as if to apologize. After a moment, she mouths to him, "I love you." Curtis nods back to her. She looks back up to the shoreline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis' feet kick up sand as he rushes back toward the condo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha hasn't moved from the porch. A light rain begins to fall. Her hands grip the railing. She turns her left palm up. Dark rain collects there.
direction.name: direction
